alert.note: Alert for Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 9:32PM MDT until August 31 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Utah, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 932 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St George, Washington, Hurricane, Santa Clara, Sand Hollow State Park, Quail Creek State Park, Ivins, Bloomington and Snow Canyon State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
